EmpiNull 1.0.0
  • Reference

Estimate Individualized Empirical Null Parameters (CRE Model)

empirical_null_ind_CF_CRE.Rd

Estimates a null proportion (p0) and a variance component (phi) for an individualized empirical null model.

Usage

empirical_null_ind_CF_CRE(
  z,
  n,
  p_grid = seq(0.8, 0.999, 0.005),
  phi_grid = seq(0.01, 5, 0.01),
  cutoff = 0.95,
  sigma_est,
  range
)

Arguments

z

A numeric vector of Z-scores.

n

A numeric vector of effective sample sizes corresponding to each Z-score.

p_grid

A numeric vector specifying the grid of null proportions (p0) to search. Defaults to a sequence from 0.8 to 0.999.

phi_grid

A numeric vector specifying the grid of the variance component (phi) to search. Defaults to a sequence from 0.01 to 5.

cutoff

A numeric value specifying the quantile for the truncation interval width. Defaults to 0.95.

sigma_est

Optional. A pre-estimated standard deviation. If provided, it defines a uniform truncation interval for all Z-scores.

range

Optional. A parameter to define a sample-size-dependent truncation interval. Takes precedence over sigma_est.

Value

A list containing the estimated parameters:

phi

The square root of the estimated variance component phi.

p

The estimated null proportion p0.

Details

The truncation interval for defining the null set is determined with the following priority:

  1. If range is provided, a sample-size-dependent interval is used.

  2. If range is missing but sigma_est is provided, a uniform interval is used.

  3. If both are missing, range is estimated using robust regression.
